title: S&P Downgrade Pushes Newell's Credit Rating Into Junk
summary: Move reverses years of missing debt targets with little consequence; Moody's still rates it investment grade. The two big bond-rating firms have allowed some large companies to retain their investment-grade status even though they repeatedly missed their debt-reduction targets. On Friday, one of the ratings firms acted, downgrading consumer products giant Newell Brands Inc. to junk territory after it slowed its pace of debt reduction.

title: Indian Activists Targeted in Alleged WhatsApp Attack Demand Answers
summary: Users want to know who deployed spyware to infiltrate activists' phones. NEW DELHI-Early last month, Shalini Gera, a human-rights activist and lawyer in India, received a jarring phone call from a cybersecurity lab at the University of Toronto.

title: Springboks Triumph at Rugby World Cup
summary: South Africa now joins New Zealand as sport's dominant team since tournament's inception in 1987. The South African national rugby team touched down in Japan some seven weeks ago painfully aware of its flaws as a World Cup pretender. And once the tournament started a few days later, with a humbling defeat to New Zealand, the Springboks knew just how much work stood between them and a shot at the trophy.

title: UAW President Gary Jones Stepping Aside Amid Federal Corruption Probe
summary: Jones departs while UAW is negotiating contracts with auto makers. United Auto Workers President Gary Jones is stepping aside from the union's top role, the union said Saturday, amid a federal investigation into corruption in the top ranks.

title: Trump Revs Up Base for Three Southern Governor Races
summary: Mr. Trump hit Mississippi on Friday and heads to Kentucky on Monday and Louisiana on Wednesday. TUPELO, Miss.-Hoping to shift the focus away from impeachment to a string of political victories, President Trump is on a barnstorming tour to boost Republican candidates in three Southern governor races.

title: Biotech Value Stocks Climb Out of Sick Bed
summary: Recent good news from Biogen and Bristol-Myers Squibb bolsters hope that years of weak performance may be ending. Good things are finally happening to cheap drug stocks.

title: Limited-Run Shows Keep on Running and Running
summary: Many productions in New York are adding weeks and months of performances.

title: Berkshire Hathaway's Cash Pile Hits a Record
summary: Conglomerate's earnings fall as unrealized investment gains decline. Berkshire Hathaway Inc.'s cash pile hit a record in the third quarter, as Warren Buffett continued his hunt for large companies to buy at attractive prices.

title: Artists and Activists See Tighter Controls on Expression in Pakistan
summary: Authorities are cracking down on free speech, they say; art installation is shut down. No sooner had Pakistani artist Adeela Suleman's exhibit opened at the Karachi Biennale last week than she had an encounter that artists, writers, journalists and activists say has become common under the current government: It was shut down.

title: The Moments That Mattered at Iowa's Democratic Dinner
summary: Pete Buttigieg sought to channel Barack Obama, and Elizabeth Warren hit back at critics. DES MOINES, Iowa-Thirteen Democratic presidential candidates addressed roughly 13,000 Democrats at the Wells Fargo Arena here, hoping to replicate Barack Obama's performance at a similar event 12 years ago that started his path to the party's nomination.

title: Beto O'Rourke Ends Presidential Bid
summary: 'My service to the country will not be as a candidate or as the nominee,' he says. DES MOINES, Iowa-Former U.S. Rep. Beto O'Rourke said Friday he was dropping out of the Democratic presidential race after failing to catch fire with voters in a crowded field.

title: Witnesses Grade Trump-Zelensky Call Transcript
summary: Key document, based on notes and voice-recognition software, found to be largely accurate. WASHINGTON-Two recent witnesses in the House impeachment inquiry shed light on a lingering question regarding the controversial July 25 call between President Trump and his Ukrainian counterpart: How accurate was the rough transcript of the call?

title: Hong Kong Police Break Out the Tear Gas Early, Sending Protesters Scrambling
summary: 'They're trying to confine the protest route, to keep it really, really confined,' a demonstrator says. HONG KONG-Police fired water cannons and tear gas early in the day in an effort to break up a pro-democracy demonstration that brought tens of thousands of people into the streets, showing recent government efforts had failed to soothe months of unrest in the city.

title: 'Unto This Last: Two Hundred Years of John Ruskin' Review: Going to Nature in His Own Fashion
summary: A potent but flawed exhibition marks the bicentennial of the birth of the critic and artist..

title: In Iowa, Democrats Offer Stark Choice for Party's Future
summary: Presidential contenders split between change and building on Obama's legacy. DES MOINES, Iowa-The leading Democratic presidential contenders, bunched together in the latest Iowa poll, sought to separate themselves from the pack in a high-stakes audition Friday night just three months before this state's leadoff caucuses.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Democrats Turn to Iowa in Search of Clarity
summary: Democratic presidential candidates turn to Iowa in search of clarity. DES MOINES, Iowa-In a presidential primary season that has become more muddled rather than less as time rolls by, Democrats this week turned to the state of Iowa to provide some clarity.

title: Evan Spiegel Stands By the Big Bet That Sank Snap's Stock
summary: As the company turns a corner, the CEO says Snapchat's controversial redesign is paying off. Santa Monica, Calif.

title: If You Can Manage a Waffle House, You Can Manage Anything
summary: Running a 24-hour budget diner isn't glamorous, but it forces leaders to serve others with speed, stamina and zero entitlement. Since she graduated from Harvard last year, Yehong Zhu has worked for Amazon.com and Twitter in Seattle, San Francisco and London. She's living in Lisbon now, gathering ideas for her own startup.

title: The Making of the World's Greatest Investor
summary: Resume Subscription. Jim Simons sat in a storefront office in a dreary Long Island strip mall. He was next to a women's clothing boutique, two doors from a pizza joint and across from a tiny, one-story train station. His office had beige wallpaper, a single computer terminal, and spotty phone service.

title: U.S. Freezes Military Aid to Lebanon
summary: Trump administration informs Congress of the move but doesn't offer a reason. WASHINGTON-The Trump administration has suspended security assistance to Lebanon, congressional officials said Friday, including more than $100 million for the Lebanese Armed Forces.

title: Deadspin Resignations Threaten New Owner's Turnaround
summary: About 20 writers and editors at former Gawker Media sports site walk out. The sports website Deadspin lost all of its editorial staff this week in an exodus that complicates its new owner's effort to turn around the former Gawker Media properties acquired a little over six months ago.

title: Trump Names Chad Wolf to Be Acting Homeland Security Secretary
summary: The White House is searching for a permanent nominee to fill the post. WASHINGTON-Chad Wolf was named to be the next acting secretary of the Homeland Security Department, the fifth person to head the department, as the Trump administration continues to struggle to fill the post on both a temporary and a permanent basis.

title: Law Firm Sues CFTC for Documents Explaining Kraft, Mondelez Settlement
summary: The lawsuit comes after a federal judge last week vacated the settlement with the food companies. A law firm has sued the Commodity Futures Trading Commission in an attempt to get an inside look at the events leading up to a settlement the agency negotiated with two food companies.

title: Rick Perry Asked to Testify in Impeachment Inquiry
summary: Spokeswoman for departing Energy secretary said he won't appear. WASHINGTON-House lawmakers have called departing Energy Secretary Rick Perry to testify in the impeachment investigation, adding another key player in the Trump administration's interactions with Ukraine to the witness roster.

title: Recipe Behind Coca-Cola's Milk Success: Less Sugar, More Protein
summary: Five years ago, soda giant went big into milk with novel formula-it paid off. For decades, conventional dairies tried to attract customers by making milk faster and cheaper. But an unexpected competitor changed the market by favoring trends over tradition.
